channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @jeffjarvis That's the key point. At least a few users have to be committed to seeing it through. The rewards are there. I imagine a good place to find users are at universities, the students. Once the system is working, they can get jobs using it. It feeds back into itself.
@jeffjarvis Thanks Jeff.
U.S. experts bracing for another coronavirus surge. https://t.co/0NQvopH4OF
Opposition to new Clinton Hill sex shop reaches climax. https://t.co/Mxr0Yjn2Uz
Putin in his last speech pretty much admitted that his next war is going to be a civil war, and I bet it never gets that far.

BTW the first feed was mine. Hereâ€™s the announcement. https://t.co/cK8fMop2hk This is why we needed blogging before anything else. It was the way new tech innovation could be announced when journalism was ignoring it.

I canâ€™t imagine Lebron has any fans left after heâ€™s left so many teams. Itâ€™s not just that he wins championships, itâ€™s that he leaves behind wrecks. Fans donâ€™t want to win as much as we want to love. Iâ€™m glad he never chose the Knicks. https://t.co/1tS1mYrNpf
I canâ€™t imagine another team accepting LeBron unless he swears he will leave the team in better condition than he found it. That would be something worth giving a try. go to Orlando, for example, and donâ€™t bring any stars with you, just work. And do it for a dollar a year.
